doc:
Richard Basehart https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Basehart 0 John Richard Basehart (August 31, 1914 – September 17, 1984) was an American actor. He starred as Admiral Harriman Nelson in the television science fiction-drama Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea (1964–68). He also portrayed Wilton Knight in the series Knight Rider (1982–86). Basehart was equally active in cinema, receiving National Board of Review Awards for his performances in Fourteen Hours (1951) and Moby Dick (1956). He was further nominated for a BAFTA Award for his role in Time Limit (1957), the directorial debut of Karl Malden. John_Richard_Basehart ( August_31_,_1914 – September_17_,_1984 ) was an_American_actor . He starred as Admiral_Harriman_Nelson in the_television_science_fiction-drama_Voyage to the_Bottom of the_Sea_(_1964 – 68_) . He also portrayed Wilton_Knight in the_series_Knight_Rider_(_1982 – 86_) . Basehart was equally_active in cinema , receiving National_Board of Review_Awards for his_performances in Fourteen_Hours ( 1951_) and Moby_Dick_(_1956_) . He was further nominated for a_BAFTA_Award for his_role in Time_Limit_(_1957_) , the_directorial_debut of Karl_Malden .
